channel.title: Looking to Build
channel.description:
Ok so in about 2 months time I'm going to build my first desktop. Since it's my first time, I need your help.
As far as specs go, here's what I've planned for so far:
[img]http://img695.imageshack.us/img695/6135/41351839.png[/img]
Criticism please.
Since I will be in Australia, I will be using www.centrecom.com.au
Questions:
1) Are these all the parts I will need? Do I need to buy anything else? Don't I need other stuff like thermal paste or cooling systems etc. 2) Is it a good idea to build this, even though I've never built before?
gogogogogogo

item.title: Looking to Build
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

my “deer” psu has been running strong for 3 years, and it came with a $30 case

Read full topic

item.title: Looking to Build
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

Either way, neither centrecom nor pccasegear seem to have any cheap 650w psus’. Looks like I’ll be sticking to the antec true power 650w. I’m also going for the Cooler Master RC-690 - Black ATX Tower Case as mwiebelhaus suggested.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking to Build
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

all psu’s from a quality retailer are all good, like pccg (no shit brands that will break)

Read full topic

item.title: Looking to Build
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

I would suggesting buying a good surge protector if you do end up deciding on buying a cheap PSU however I totally agree with Thug-Life that you should invest in a quality one.
As well as upgrading, think about how much money you could loose if there’s a power surge and your cheap off-market PSU fries your motherboard, CPU and memory and possibly some other components.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking to Build
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

It really depends, many people do say that they have had cheap PSU’s and have lasted them years. But there is often review sites doing tests that have them blow up and sometimes take out hardware with them.

For me, i won’t build a computer without a good quality, well known PSU. Its up to you, there isn’t anything definite about it - but i’d rather be safe and have a quality PSU with a great warranty in a computer with such expensive components.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking to Build
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:18, topic:340039”]I say this to anyone looking to build a high end PC. Shoot above what you need when it comes to a PSU if you can, so many times have i seen people wanting to upgrade a few years later with just a few components only to find their PSU is no longer sufficient.

I paid extra for a Corsair HX850w (modular) PSU which is rated to run at 1000w’s constantly, but thats Corsairs way of keeping longevity high, despite my build being capable on a 650W. I plan on going for higher end GPUs at some point within the next few years and more of them, along with more HDDs/SSDs, etc, so that with the 8 year warranty should last me for another build or two.[/quote]

I might as well stick with a 650W. But I think it’s better if I use a cheaper brand instead of Antec. There’s no risk in using cheaper brands right?

Read full topic

item.title: Looking to Build
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

I say this to anyone looking to build a high end PC. Shoot above what you need when it comes to a PSU if you can, so many times have i seen people wanting to upgrade a few years later with just a few components only to find their PSU is no longer sufficient.

I paid extra for a Corsair HX850w (modular) PSU which is rated to run at 1000w’s constantly, but thats Corsairs way of keeping longevity high, despite my build being capable on a 650W. I plan on going for higher end GPUs at some point within the next few years and more of them, along with more HDDs/SSDs, etc, so that with the 8 year warranty should last me for another build or two.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking to Build
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

[quote=“sppt, post:16, topic:340039”][quote author=Radeon link=topic=436416.msg3208216#msg3208216 date=1273992500]
I was initially planning to use pccasegear but I found www.centrecom.com.au to be cheaper in almost everything. It’s also close enough so that I can drive there so I don’t have to pay for delivery.

I might change to this http://www.centrecom.com.au/catalog/product_info.php?keywords=500w&products_id=43143

Does it have enough connectors?
M/B 20+4 Pin x 1
CPU 4+4 Pin x 1
PCI-E 6 Pin x 1
4 Pin Peripheral x 5
SATA x 4
4 Pin Floppy x 1
[/quote]
No, you’ll want two PCI-e 6 pins for that card, it’s required iirc and a molex/peripheral->pcie plug wont do.[/quote]
sure it will do, i’m currently using 4x molex to 2x pci-e 6pin to power my GTX260 since my shit psu don’t have any 6 pin coords.

Radeon with the vid card is usually 2x connectors (2x molex > 1x pci-e 6pin) so your fine there.

Read full topic

SATA x 4
4 Pin Floppy x 1[/quote]
No, you’ll want two PCI-e 6 pins for that card, it’s required iirc and a molex/peripheral->pcie plug wont do.

I’m guessing it’s cheaper because you forgot to include the harddrive.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking to Build
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

i’m not sure what your budget is, but consider a better case (CM 690 advanced II) (about another 80$)

also use pccasegear.com (best australian PC online shop) (i shop their all the time)

3026iba.png771×523

^ cheaper, has 24" HD monitor and a modular power supply.

like i said, if you can scrape up another 50-100$ get a better case.

that power supply is great value @ 99$, check out the reviews, people can squeeze out over 730w from the 550w PSU (huntkey claim it can do 600w easy), it’s modular and it’s cables are long and short.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking to Build
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“Radeon, post:7, topic:340039”][quote author=Niall link=topic=436416.msg3206298#msg3206298 date=1273859691]

The only thing I can think of is the monitor, are you playing to play full HD on it? If so you might want to get a different monitor that does support the 1080p resolution.

It’s gonna cost me an extra $66 is that worth it? I don’t know if my card will be able to handle resolutions like that in the near future.

Definitely

Get a 22" with 1920 x 1080 resolution, although 1680x1050 is fine. If you want to save some money scrap the antec psu and get a cheapish 500w one.

  1. Should come with the psu, either way stock cooling will be fine if you don’t let it get clogged up with dust, literally.
  2. If I were you, I’d try and find a really cheap($<50) 15" lcd monitor and a bigger harddrive.
    [/quote]
    Are there 15" 1080p monitors?

how can you live with a 15" monitor…

i dont understand how it can be so expensive, i dont see anything there that would make it cost nearly 2 grand

Parts from Australia and Australian dollars :s

Different case, antec 300 is a great case but your going to have to do some moding if you want decent cable managment.

Is there anything I can get that wouldn’t need any modding for decent cable management?[/quote]

CM Master 690 Verison II buts its not avaliable on the site you listed, only the old version which is much better than the antec 300 but it does have more cable mangment.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking to Build
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Radeon, post:9, topic:340039”][quote author=Niall link=topic=436416.msg3207408#msg3207408 date=1273932283]
I mean as a second monitor. 22" is great and all but nothing beats being able to read irc and things while in a fullscreen app.
[/quote]

Great idea. I will definitely be looking into doing that, but maybe a couple of months after I get my rig.

Is 500watt enough for my build?[/quote]

It should do fine.

Read full topic

Ok so in about 2 months time I’m going to build my first desktop. Since it’s my first time, I need your help.

As far as specs go, here’s what I’ve planned for so far:

Criticism please.

Since I will be in Australia, I will be using www.centrecom.com.au

  1. Are these all the parts I will need? Do I need to buy anything else? Don’t I need other stuff like thermal paste or cooling systems etc.
